sources: Lyon, J. (1996) Yugoslavia's Hyperinflation 1993-1994: A Social History
notes: Second-longest hyperinflation after 1920s Russia (22 months). Peak monthly inflation: 313 million percent (January 1994). Prices doubled every 1.4 days. Multiple redenominations: Jul 1992 (10:1), Oct 1993 (1M:1), Jan 1994 (1B:1). Stabilized with novi dinar pegged to DM on January 24, 1994.
